channel.title: Comments on: Server and Client Operating Systems

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2010/11/17/server-and-client-operating-systems/#comment-3578">Julien</a>.
I think that is true in a general sense. However there are some systems that are obviously targeted to perform well as servers and others to excel as a client. Not that they can't switch roles, just that they serve best in one or the other, but not usually both.

item.title: By: Julien
item.dc:creator: Julien
item.description: Oddly enough, I think the general client/server pattern is disappearing to a true peer to peer model, where each computer becomes a server to other others and is a client to others.
item.content:encoded: Oddly enough, I think the general client/server pattern is disappearing to a true peer to peer model, where each computer becomes a server to other others and is a client to others.
